text:
A general view westward from West Kingsbridge Road, below Heath Ave., showing, in the background the Harlem River and the Broadway bridge connecting Manhattan with the Bronx. Across the bridge, on the right is the Spuyten Duyvil section of the Bronx, and on the left, Inwood Hill Park, Manhattan.

October 1923.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2)

The same, another view. In the center of the view is discernible the oval New York Velodrome.

October 1923.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
title: General View - Bronx - Kingsbridge Road below Heath Avenue.

Bridges - Broadway Bridge - Harlem River - [Broadway - 225th Street.]
Bridges - Broadway Bridge - Harlem River - [Broadway - 225th Street.]
Bridges - Broadway Bridge - Harlem River - [Broadway - 225th Street.]

text:
Harlem River Bridges: 225th Street-Broadway-- The vehicular and subway bridge over the northern tip of Manhattan island at 225th Street. Broadway rons over the bridge. The views are east along the river, showing Baker field in the right foreground and Kingsbridge Heights, Bronx, in the background.

View 3 is in a northwesterly direction and shows apartment houses on Marble Hill.

P. L. Sperr

1939
Views 1-3
title: Bridges - Broadway Bridge - Harlem River.
